responses.question_text: Do you have ISO 27001 certification?
responses.answer_text: Yes, HealthSys.io maintains ISO 27001:2013 certification with annual surveillance audits by TÜV SÜD. Our certification covers all healthcare data processing operations and has been continuously maintained since 2019.
responses.evidence: ISO 27001:2013 Certificate #HS-ISO-2024-001

responses.question_text: What is your SOC 2 compliance status?
responses.answer_text: HealthSys.io maintains SOC 2 Type II compliance with annual audits by Ernst & Young covering Security, Availability, and Confidentiality. We also maintain HITRUST CSF certification which includes SOC 2 requirements.
responses.evidence: SOC 2 Type II Report 2024 & HITRUST CSF Certification

responses.question_text: How do you handle GDPR compliance?
responses.answer_text: We maintain GDPR compliance with appointed EU DPO, data processing agreements with all customers, privacy by design implementation, DPIA for all PHI processing, and comprehensive patient data rights management.
responses.evidence: GDPR Healthcare Compliance Framework v2.5

responses.question_text: What encryption standards do you use?
responses.answer_text: HealthSys.io uses AES-256 encryption for PHI at rest and TLS 1.3 for data in transit per HIPAA requirements. All encryption implementations are FIPS 140-2 validated. Database-level encryption is mandatory for all patient data.
responses.evidence: HIPAA Encryption Standards & Implementation HES-2024

responses.question_text: Do you support multi-factor authentication?
responses.answer_text: Yes, MFA is mandatory for all users accessing PHI using authenticator apps, SMS, email, and hardware tokens. Healthcare providers can use badge-based authentication. Patient portals support biometric authentication.
responses.evidence: Authentication Security Policy - HIPAA Compliant ASP-2024

responses.question_text: What is your data backup frequency?
responses.answer_text: Patient health information is backed up every 4 hours with continuous database transaction logs. Daily snapshots retained for 30 days, weekly for 1 year, and annual backups for 7 years per HIPAA retention requirements.
responses.evidence: Backup & Recovery Procedures - Healthcare Regulatory BR-2024

responses.question_text: How often do you conduct penetration testing?
responses.answer_text: We conduct annual HIPAA-focused penetration tests by healthcare security specialists and quarterly vulnerability assessments. PHI-containing systems undergo additional testing before major releases. Critical findings remediated within 72 hours.
responses.evidence: Security Testing Report 2024 - Healthcare Compliance

responses.question_text: What is your incident response time?
responses.answer_text: Our Security Operations Center operates 24/7 with 15-minute response time for PHI breach incidents and 30-minute response for other security incidents. HIPAA breach assessment initiated immediately upon incident detection.
responses.evidence: HIPAA Incident Response Plan & SLA IRP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a Business Continuity Plan?
responses.answer_text: Yes, our BCP meets HIPAA contingency planning requirements with RTO of 4 hours for clinical systems and RPO of 15 minutes for patient data. Disaster recovery drills conducted quarterly with healthcare scenarios.
responses.evidence: Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Plan - HIPAA Compliant v3.0

responses.question_text: What is your data retention policy?
responses.answer_text: Patient health records retained for 7 years minimum (10 years for pediatric records) per HIPAA and state-specific requirements. De-identification processes follow HIPAA Safe Harbor method. Secure deletion uses NIST 800-88 standards.
responses.evidence: Healthcare Records Retention & Disposal Policy HRDP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you manage access control?
responses.answer_text: Role-based access control implements minimum necessary standard per HIPAA. Access to PHI logged and audited. Emergency access procedures available with post-access review. Access recertification quarterly with automatic termination of unused accounts.
responses.evidence: HIPAA Access Control & Minimum Necessary Policy AC-2024

responses.question_text: What security training do employees receive?
responses.answer_text: All workforce members complete annual HIPAA Privacy and Security training within 30 days of hire. Additional quarterly training on phishing, ransomware, and patient privacy. Healthcare-specific security scenarios included.
responses.evidence: HIPAA Security Awareness Training Program 2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a vulnerability management program?
responses.answer_text: Continuous vulnerability scanning with weekly authenticated scans of all systems containing PHI. Critical vulnerabilities patched within 48 hours, high within 7 days per HIPAA Security Rule requirements. Vulnerability trends reported monthly.
responses.evidence: Vulnerability Management Program - HIPAA Aligned VMP-2024

responses.question_text: What antivirus/endpoint protection do you use?
responses.answer_text: All endpoints deploy Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with ransomware protection, behavioral monitoring, and healthcare-specific threat detection. Medical device networks have specialized endpoint protection. Updates managed centrally.
responses.evidence: Endpoint Protection Standards - Healthcare EPS-2024

responses.question_text: How do you secure your network?
responses.answer_text: Network security includes firewall protection, IDS/IPS, network segmentation isolating PHI systems, encrypted VPN for remote access, and wireless security with WPA3 encryption. Medical IoT devices on separate VLANs.
responses.evidence: Network Security Architecture - HIPAA Compliant NSA-2024

responses.question_text: Do you perform background checks on employees?
responses.answer_text: All employees with PHI access undergo comprehensive background checks including criminal history, identity verification, employment verification, and education verification per HIPAA workforce security standards.
responses.evidence: Workforce Screening Policy - Healthcare Compliance WSP-2024

responses.question_text: What is your password policy?
responses.answer_text: Passwords require minimum 12 characters with complexity per HIPAA Security Rule. Automatic timeout after 15 minutes of inactivity for PHI systems. Password expiration every 90 days. Lockout after 5 failed attempts.
responses.evidence: Password & Session Security Policy - HIPAA PSP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a secure software development lifecycle?
responses.answer_text: Our SDLC includes HIPAA security requirements in design phase, privacy impact assessment, secure coding practices, SAST/DAST testing, PHI handling validation, and security sign-off before production release.
responses.evidence: Secure Development Lifecycle - Healthcare Applications SDL-v3.0

responses.question_text: How do you handle data breaches?
responses.answer_text: HIPAA breach protocol includes immediate containment, breach assessment within 24 hours, notification to affected individuals within 60 days, HHS notification for breaches affecting 500+ individuals, and annual breach reporting to OCR.
responses.evidence: HIPAA Breach Notification & Response Procedures HBNRP-2024

responses.question_text: What cloud providers do you use?
responses.answer_text: HealthSys.io operates on AWS (HIPAA-eligible services) and Microsoft Azure for Healthcare with signed Business Associate Agreements. All cloud configurations meet HIPAA Security Rule requirements. PHI stored in US regions only.
responses.evidence: Cloud Infrastructure - HIPAA BAA & Configuration CIP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you encrypt data in transit?
responses.answer_text: All PHI in transit encrypted using TLS 1.3 with HIPAA-compliant cipher suites. HL7/FHIR API communications use mTLS. Email containing PHI requires secure email gateway with encryption. Legacy protocols disabled.
responses.evidence: Data Transmission Security - HIPAA Compliant DTS-2024

responses.question_text: How do you manage third-party vendor risk?
responses.answer_text: All business associates sign BAAs before PHI access. Vendors undergo HIPAA security assessment, annual compliance review, and security questionnaires. Critical vendors included in breach response planning. Subcontractor BAAs required.
responses.evidence: Business Associate Management Program BAMP-2024

responses.question_text: What is your change management process?
responses.answer_text: Changes to PHI systems follow CAB approval process with security impact assessment, testing in isolated environment, change documentation, rollback procedures, and post-implementation validation. Emergency changes documented retrospectively.
responses.evidence: Change Management Policy - Healthcare Systems CMP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a DDoS mitigation strategy?
responses.answer_text: Yes, DDoS protection via Cloudflare Healthcare ensures availability of patient care systems. Multi-layered protection with automatic mitigation up to 200 Tbps. Clinical system availability is prioritized with dedicated capacity.
responses.evidence: DDoS Protection & Healthcare System Availability Plan DPHSA-2024

responses.question_text: How do you monitor system logs?
responses.answer_text: All access to PHI is logged per HIPAA audit controls requirement. Logs aggregated in Splunk with 6-year retention, tamper protection, encryption, and automated alerting for suspicious PHI access patterns.
responses.evidence: HIPAA Audit Controls & Log Management Policy ACLM-2024

responses.question_text: What is your disaster recovery plan?
responses.answer_text: HIPAA-compliant DR with active-passive configuration, RTO of 4 hours for clinical systems, RPO of 15 minutes for patient data. Testing semi-annually with healthcare continuity scenarios. DR plan updated annually.
responses.evidence: Disaster Recovery Plan - Healthcare Operations DRP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you segregate customer data?
responses.answer_text: Each healthcare organization has dedicated database instance with separate encryption keys and access controls. Multi-tenant architecture includes logical separation with PHI access restrictions preventing cross-customer data access.
responses.evidence: Healthcare Multi-Tenancy Security Architecture HMTSA-2024

responses.question_text: What database encryption do you use?
responses.answer_text: All databases containing PHI use Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) with AES-256. Column-level encryption for sensitive fields (SSN, diagnosis codes). Encryption key management via AWS KMS with HIPAA BAA.
responses.evidence: Database Encryption - HIPAA Safeguards DBE-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle security patches?
responses.answer_text: Critical security patches for internet-facing systems within 48 hours, high-severity within 7 days, routine patches monthly. Medical device integration systems have coordinated patching to maintain clinical operations.
responses.evidence: Patch Management - Healthcare Systems PMP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have cyber insurance?
responses.answer_text: Yes, HealthSys.io maintains $20M healthcare cyber liability insurance covering HIPAA breach costs, regulatory fines (OCR/state), patient notification, credit monitoring, and legal defense.
responses.evidence: Healthcare Cyber Liability Insurance Policy #HCI-2024

responses.question_text: What compliance frameworks do you follow?
responses.answer_text: We maintain compliance with HIPAA Security & Privacy Rules, HITRUST CSF, SOC 2, ISO 27001, GDPR (for EU patients), state privacy laws (CCPA, etc.), and FDA guidance for medical device software.
responses.evidence: Healthcare Compliance Framework Matrix 2024

responses.question_text: How do you protect against ransomware?
responses.answer_text: Ransomware protection critical for healthcare operations includes immutable backups, EDR with healthcare threat intelligence, email advanced threat protection, network segmentation, application whitelisting on clinical systems, and monthly ransomware drills.
responses.evidence: Healthcare Ransomware Defense Program - Clinical Continuity HRDP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you perform code reviews?
responses.answer_text: All code changes require peer review with additional privacy review for PHI-handling features. Security team reviews authentication, authorization, and encryption implementations. Code review checklist includes HIPAA requirements.
responses.evidence: Secure Code Review Standards - Healthcare SCRS-2024

responses.question_text: What is your data classification policy?
responses.answer_text: Data classified as Public, Internal, Confidential, PHI, and Sensitive PHI (substance abuse, mental health, genetic). Each level has specific HIPAA safeguards. Automated classification via DLP for PHI identification.
responses.evidence: Healthcare Data Classification & Handling Policy HDCHP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure API security?
responses.answer_text: FHIR/HL7 APIs implement OAuth 2.0 with SMART on FHIR authorization, patient context validation, consent verification, rate limiting, comprehensive audit logging, and HIPAA-compliant access controls.
responses.evidence: Healthcare API Security Standards - FHIR/HL7 Compliant HASS-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a bug bounty program?
responses.answer_text: Yes, we operate a private bug bounty via HackerOne focused on healthcare security researchers. Rewards up to $15,000 for critical PHI exposure vulnerabilities. Program excludes testing on production PHI.
responses.evidence: Responsible Disclosure Program - Healthcare Security RDP-2024

responses.question_text: What email security measures do you use?
responses.answer_text: Email security includes Proofpoint for threat protection, mandatory encryption for emails containing PHI via secure portal, SPF/DKIM/DMARC, phishing protection, and healthcare-specific social engineering detection.
responses.evidence: Email Security & PHI Communication Policy ESP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle cryptographic key management?
responses.answer_text: Encryption keys for PHI stored in AWS KMS and Azure Key Vault (HIPAA BAA signed) with automatic rotation every 90 days. Key access logged and monitored. Separate keys per customer and data classification.
responses.evidence: Cryptographic Key Management - HIPAA Compliant CKM-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have physical security controls?
responses.answer_text: Data centers meet HIPAA physical safeguards with 24/7 security, biometric access, video surveillance (90-day retention), visitor logs, equipment tracking, and workstation security. Healthcare-specific facility security standards.
responses.evidence: Physical Security Standards - HIPAA Safeguards PSS-2024

responses.question_text: What is your mobile device security policy?
responses.answer_text: Mobile devices accessing PHI require MDM (Microsoft Intune), encryption, remote wipe, containerization, biometric authentication, and app-level security. BYOD requires MAM with PHI data segregation.
responses.evidence: Mobile Device Management - Healthcare PHI Access MDM-2024

responses.question_text: How do you secure container deployments?
responses.answer_text: Container security for healthcare microservices includes image signing, vulnerability scanning, runtime protection, secrets management, network policies, and compliance scanning for HIPAA requirements. PHI containers have additional controls.
responses.evidence: Container Security Framework - Healthcare Applications CSF-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a security incident escalation process?
responses.answer_text: Incidents classified as HIPAA Breach (PHI exposure), Security Incident (attempted breach), or Privacy Incident (inappropriate access). PHI breaches escalate to Privacy Officer, CISO, legal, and CEO immediately for breach assessment.
responses.evidence: Security Incident Classification & Escalation - HIPAA SICE-2024

responses.question_text: What data loss prevention measures do you have?
responses.answer_text: DLP deployed on email, endpoints, web, and cloud with PHI pattern detection (SSN, MRN, diagnosis codes). Policies prevent unauthorized PHI transmission. DLP alerts trigger privacy investigation and potential breach assessment.
responses.evidence: Data Loss Prevention - PHI Protection DLP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure secure remote access?
responses.answer_text: Remote access to PHI requires VPN with MFA, endpoint compliance verification (antivirus, encryption, patching), session timeout after 15 minutes inactivity, and automatic disconnect after 8 hours per HIPAA automatic logoff.
responses.evidence: Remote Access Policy - HIPAA Security Rule RAP-2024

responses.question_text: What is your security audit frequency?
responses.answer_text: Annual HIPAA Security Rule compliance audit, annual HITRUST assessment, SOC 2 audit, ISO 27001 surveillance audit, quarterly internal security audits, and annual risk assessment. OCR audit readiness maintained continuously.
responses.evidence: Healthcare Compliance Audit Schedule 2024

responses.question_text: How do you manage privileged access?
responses.answer_text: Privileged access to PHI databases uses CyberArk PAM with password rotation, session recording (PHI access), approval workflows, just-in-time access, and emergency break-glass procedures with post-access review.
responses.evidence: Privileged Access Management - Healthcare Systems PAM-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a secure code repository?
responses.answer_text: Code in GitHub Enterprise Cloud (HIPAA BAA) with branch protection, code review requirements, secrets scanning, signed commits, and access controls. PHI test data prohibited in repositories; synthetic data used instead.
responses.evidence: Source Code Security - Healthcare Development SCM-2024

responses.question_text: What threat intelligence do you use?
responses.answer_text: Healthcare threat intelligence from H-ISAC, FBI Healthcare Cybersecurity Partnership, HHS alerts, and commercial feeds. Intelligence focuses on healthcare-targeting ransomware, phishing campaigns, and medical device vulnerabilities.
responses.evidence: Healthcare Threat Intelligence Program HTIP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle security exceptions?
responses.answer_text: Security exceptions require HIPAA risk analysis, compensating controls documentation, Privacy Officer and CISO approval, time limitation (maximum 90 days), and inclusion in annual HIPAA risk assessment.
responses.evidence: Security Exception & Risk Acceptance Policy - HIPAA SERAP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you perform security metrics tracking?
responses.answer_text: Security KPIs tracked include: PHI access audit findings, breach incidents, vulnerability remediation times, training completion, audit findings, patient privacy complaints, and OCR compliance metrics. Reported quarterly to board.
responses.evidence: Healthcare Security Metrics & Compliance Dashboard Q3-2024

responses.question_text: What is your data anonymization approach?
responses.answer_text: De-identification follows HIPAA Safe Harbor method removing 18 identifiers, or Expert Determination with statistical disclosure control. Re-identification risk assessed. Limited Data Sets used when full de-identification not feasible.
responses.evidence: HIPAA De-identification & Anonymization Standards HDAS-2024

responses.question_text: How do you secure APIs at the network level?
responses.answer_text: Healthcare APIs accessible via API gateway with IP whitelisting for partner integrations, DDoS protection, WAF with OWASP healthcare rulesets, rate limiting, and network segmentation. FHIR APIs support healthcare exchange standards.
responses.evidence: API Network Security - Healthcare Interoperability ANSH-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have asset inventory management?
responses.answer_text: Comprehensive hardware and software inventory in ServiceNow with PHI-containing systems flagged. Medical device inventory includes FDA classifications. Inventory reconciliation monthly. Decommissioned assets undergo PHI sanitization.
responses.evidence: Healthcare Asset Management & Inventory Policy HAMIP-2024

responses.question_text: What is your approach to secrets management?
responses.answer_text: Secrets for PHI systems stored in HashiCorp Vault with encryption, access policies, automatic rotation, and audit logging. API keys for healthcare integrations (HL7, FHIR) managed centrally. Hard-coded secrets prevented via scanning.
responses.evidence: Secrets Management - Healthcare Applications SMP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure supply chain security?
responses.answer_text: Software supply chain includes SBOM requirements, FDA guidance compliance for medical software, dependency scanning for healthcare libraries, vendor security assessments with BAAs, and medical device patch management coordination.
responses.evidence: Healthcare Software Supply Chain Security HSSCS-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a security champion program?
responses.answer_text: Security champions in clinical, revenue cycle, and patient engagement teams receive HIPAA-focused training, participate in privacy reviews, conduct security design reviews, and serve as privacy/security liaisons.
responses.evidence: Healthcare Security Champion Program v2.0

responses.question_text: What is your approach to zero trust?
responses.answer_text: Zero trust implementation for healthcare includes identity verification, device trust, continuous authentication, micro-segmentation around PHI systems, least privilege, and assume breach posture aligned with NIST healthcare guidance.
responses.evidence: Zero Trust Architecture - Healthcare Implementation Roadmap ZTA-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle secure deletion?
responses.answer_text: PHI deletion follows HIPAA disposal requirements using NIST SP 800-88 methods: cryptographic erasure, overwriting, or physical destruction. Deletion certificates retained for 6 years. Medical device sanitization follows manufacturer guidance.
responses.evidence: Secure PHI Disposal Procedures - HIPAA Compliant SPDP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have security awareness for executives?
responses.answer_text: Executives complete HIPAA compliance training, quarterly healthcare security briefings covering ransomware trends, OCR enforcement actions, patient privacy incidents, and board-level cyber risk workshops annually.
responses.evidence: Executive Security & Privacy Education Program 2024

responses.question_text: What is your cloud security posture management?
responses.answer_text: Prisma Cloud monitors HIPAA-eligible AWS/Azure services for configuration compliance, automated remediation for critical findings, HIPAA Security Rule alignment checks, and integration with change management for cloud resources.
responses.evidence: Cloud Security Posture - HIPAA Compliance Monitoring CSPM-2024

responses.question_text: How do you perform security architecture reviews?
responses.answer_text: All projects with PHI undergo security architecture review including HIPAA requirements assessment, privacy impact analysis, threat modeling (focused on PHI exposure), data flow diagrams, and technical safeguards validation.
responses.evidence: Security Architecture Review - Healthcare Applications SARA-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a red team program?
responses.answer_text: Annual red team exercises simulate healthcare-targeted attacks including ransomware, patient data theft, medical device compromise, and insider threats. Exercises test clinical continuity plans and breach response.
responses.evidence: Red Team Exercise Report 2024 - Healthcare Attack Scenarios

responses.question_text: What is your approach to database activity monitoring?
responses.answer_text: Imperva DAM monitors all PHI database access with real-time alerting for suspicious queries, privileged user monitoring, query blocking for unauthorized access, and HIPAA audit trail generation. Minimum necessary validation included.
responses.evidence: Database Activity Monitoring - PHI Protection DAM-2024

responses.question_text: How do you manage security debt?
responses.answer_text: Security debt tracked with HIPAA risk scoring, aging analysis, and quarterly Privacy Officer/CISO review. Critical security debt affecting PHI protection prioritized over features. Remediation tracked to closure.
responses.evidence: Security Technical Debt - Healthcare Risk Management STDHRM-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have insider threat detection?
responses.answer_text: Insider threat detection includes UEBA monitoring PHI access patterns, after-hours access alerts, bulk PHI download detection, terminated employee monitoring, celebrity patient access monitoring, and HR integration for at-risk indicators.
responses.evidence: Insider Threat Detection - Healthcare PHI Protection ITD-2024

responses.question_text: What is your security testing coverage?
responses.answer_text: 100% SAST coverage for PHI-handling code, all patient-facing applications undergo annual penetration testing, HL7/FHIR interfaces tested quarterly, medical device integrations tested before deployment, continuous vulnerability scanning.
responses.evidence: Security Testing Standards - Healthcare Compliance STS-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure compliance in CI/CD?
responses.answer_text: CI/CD security gates include SAST, dependency scanning, HIPAA compliance checks, PHI handling validation, secrets detection, container scanning, and privacy review for PHI features. Failed security checks block deployment.
responses.evidence: Secure CI/CD - Healthcare Applications SCDH-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a secure configuration baseline?
responses.answer_text: All systems follow HIPAA Security Rule technical safeguards and CIS benchmarks. Configuration compliance monitored continuously. PHI systems have enhanced hardening. Configuration drift triggers automated tickets.
responses.evidence: Secure Configuration Standards - HIPAA Compliant SCS-2024

responses.question_text: What is your approach to API versioning security?
responses.answer_text: FHIR API versions supported per HL7 standards. Legacy versions deprecated with 12-month notice to healthcare partners. Security patches backported to supported versions. Patient-facing APIs have extended support lifecycle.
responses.evidence: Healthcare API Lifecycle Management - FHIR Standards HALM-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle security for mergers and acquisitions?
responses.answer_text: Healthcare M&A due diligence includes HIPAA compliance review, BAA requirements, OCR enforcement action history, breach history, PHI handling assessment, and 180-day HIPAA integration plan with gap remediation.
responses.evidence: M&A Security Due Diligence - Healthcare MADDHC-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have security orchestration and automation?
responses.answer_text: Splunk Phantom SOAR automates PHI breach assessment workflow, threat enrichment, ransomware response playbooks, and investigation case management. 65% of security alerts automated. Healthcare continuity maintained.
responses.evidence: Security Automation - Healthcare Operations SAHO-2024

responses.question_text: What is your approach to security in DevOps?
responses.answer_text: DevSecOps for healthcare includes security champions, HIPAA requirements in user stories, automated security testing, PHI handling validation, privacy review gates, and security metrics in team dashboards.
responses.evidence: DevSecOps - Healthcare Application Development v2.0

responses.question_text: How do you manage security for SaaS applications?
responses.answer_text: SaaS apps require HIPAA compliance verification, BAA signing, security assessment, PHI data residency confirmation, SSO integration, and Netskope CASB monitoring. PHI prohibited in non-compliant SaaS.
responses.evidence: SaaS Security - Healthcare BAA Requirements SSP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have network segmentation?
responses.answer_text: Network segmented per HIPAA addressable specification: PHI systems isolated, medical devices on separate VLANs, guest wireless separated, inter-segment firewalls, and micro-segmentation for high-value clinical systems.
responses.evidence: Network Segmentation - HIPAA Security Architecture NSA-2024

responses.question_text: What is your certificate management process?
responses.answer_text: Certificates managed via Venafi with 30-day renewal before expiration, extended validation certs for patient portals, certificate pinning for mobile health apps, and HL7/FHIR mTLS certificate lifecycle management.
responses.evidence: PKI & Certificate Management - Healthcare PKI-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure security in machine learning models?
responses.answer_text: Healthcare ML models (diagnosis prediction, risk scoring) undergo bias testing, privacy-preserving ML techniques, model explainability validation, HIPAA privacy review, adversarial testing, and FDA software validation when applicable.
responses.evidence: ML Security & Privacy Framework - Healthcare AI MSPFHA-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a security governance framework?
responses.answer_text: Security governance includes quarterly board HIPAA compliance reporting, Privacy Officer and Security Officer roles per HIPAA, annual risk analysis, security management process, and OCR audit readiness program.
responses.evidence: HIPAA Security Governance Framework 2024

responses.question_text: What is your data residency and sovereignty approach?
responses.answer_text: US patient data stored in US AWS regions only per HIPAA. EU patient data in EU regions per GDPR. State-specific requirements (e.g., Texas medical records) honored. Cross-border PHI transfers prohibited except per patient consent.
responses.evidence: Healthcare Data Residency Policy - HIPAA/GDPR HDRP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle security for IoT devices?
responses.answer_text: Medical IoT devices (patient monitors, infusion pumps) on isolated VLANs, FDA cybersecurity guidance compliance, medical device risk assessment, patch coordination with manufacturers, and network monitoring for anomalies.
responses.evidence: Medical Device & IoT Security Standards - FDA Aligned MDIS-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have quantum-safe cryptography plans?
responses.answer_text: Monitoring NIST post-quantum cryptography for healthcare applications with long-term PHI storage. Crypto-agility in architecture enables future algorithm migration. Quantum risk assessment completed for 20+ year PHI retention.
responses.evidence: Quantum Cryptography Readiness - Healthcare QCRH-2024

responses.question_text: What is your security incident lessons learned process?
responses.answer_text: All PHI incidents undergo post-incident review within 5 days with root cause analysis, HIPAA compliance assessment, OCR notification decision, lessons learned, and remediation actions. Findings integrated into risk analysis.
responses.evidence: Post-Incident Review - HIPAA Compliance PIR-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure secure software dependencies?
responses.answer_text: Healthcare application dependencies scanned via Snyk and Dependabot, vulnerability monitoring for medical software libraries, FDA SBOM guidance compliance, automated security updates, and healthcare-specific dependency review.
responses.evidence: Software Dependency Security - Healthcare Applications SDS-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have security metrics for executives?
responses.answer_text: Executive dashboard includes: HIPAA compliance score, PHI breach incidents, OCR complaint status, audit findings, patient privacy metrics, vendor BAA status, security training completion, and healthcare security benchmarking.
responses.evidence: Executive Healthcare Security Dashboard - Board Reporting Q3-2024

responses.question_text: What is your approach to security in infrastructure as code?
responses.answer_text: IaC scanned for HIPAA compliance via Checkov, policy enforcement for PHI systems, peer review required, compliance-as-code validation, immutable infrastructure for clinical systems, and audit trails for infrastructure changes.
responses.evidence: Infrastructure as Code - Healthcare Compliance IaCS-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle data subject access requests?
responses.answer_text: Patient access requests managed per HIPAA Right of Access with 30-day response, electronic delivery in patient-requested format, access logs, reasonable cost-based fees, and denial tracking. GDPR requests have separate workflow.
responses.evidence: Patient Rights & Access Request Procedures - HIPAA PRAR-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have security requirements for contractors?
responses.answer_text: Contractors with PHI access undergo background screening, HIPAA training within 30 days, BAA signing, separate contractor accounts, minimum necessary access, and immediate termination upon contract end.
responses.evidence: Contractor & Workforce Security - HIPAA CWS-2024

responses.question_text: What is your security testing for APIs?
responses.answer_text: FHIR/HL7 API testing includes OWASP API Top 10, SMART on FHIR authorization testing, patient context validation, consent enforcement testing, PHI exposure testing, and interoperability testing with EHR systems.
responses.evidence: Healthcare API Security Testing - FHIR/HL7 HAST-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure security in microservices?
responses.answer_text: Healthcare microservices include service mesh mTLS, API gateway authentication, PHI access logging, distributed tracing for audit, secrets injection, network policies, and HIPAA minimum necessary enforcement per service.
responses.evidence: Microservices Security - Healthcare Architecture MSA-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a security research program?
responses.answer_text: Our Healthcare Security Research team participates in H-ISAC working groups, publishes healthcare threat research, collaborates with FDA on medical device security, and maintains relationships with HHS cybersecurity team.
responses.evidence: Healthcare Security Research & Collaboration Program 2024

responses.question_text: What is your employee offboarding security process?
responses.answer_text: Healthcare workforce offboarding includes immediate PHI access revocation, account deactivation within 1 hour, device recovery, exit interview covering HIPAA confidentiality obligations, and 60-day access attempt monitoring.
responses.evidence: Workforce Offboarding - HIPAA Termination Procedures WOT-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle security for remote workers?
responses.answer_text: Remote healthcare workers require company devices with EDR, VPN with MFA, PHI access logging, home office privacy guidance (HIPAA physical safeguards), webcam covers, and monthly security compliance verification.
responses.evidence: Remote Work Security - Healthcare PHI Access RWSP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have security requirements in vendor contracts?
responses.answer_text: Vendor contracts include HIPAA Business Associate Agreements, security requirements appendix, encryption standards, breach notification within 24 hours, annual compliance attestation, audit rights, and OCR cooperation clauses.
responses.evidence: Vendor Contract Security Requirements - HIPAA BAA Template

responses.question_text: What is your security approach for blockchain/distributed ledger?
responses.answer_text: We are piloting blockchain for patient consent management with security controls: permissioned blockchain, PHI stored off-chain with pointers, smart contract security review, HIPAA compliance assessment, and patient privacy evaluation.
responses.evidence: Blockchain Security Framework - Healthcare Pilot BSF-2024

responses.question_text: How do you measure security culture?
responses.answer_text: Healthcare security culture measured via quarterly surveys, HIPAA training compliance, phishing simulation (target <3% for clinical users), privacy incident self-reporting rates, and patient privacy culture assessment.
responses.evidence: Healthcare Security & Privacy Culture Assessment Q3-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have security playbooks for common scenarios?
responses.answer_text: We maintain 30+ playbooks including: ransomware affecting clinical operations, PHI breach assessment, medical device compromise, HL7 interface failure, patient identity theft, unauthorized PHI access, and OCR investigation response.
responses.evidence: Healthcare Security Playbook Library v4.0

responses.question_text: What is your security budget and resource allocation?
responses.answer_text: Security budget is 10% of IT budget ($8M annually) with dedicated HIPAA compliance budget. Allocation: 45% personnel (Security + Privacy teams), 35% technology, 15% compliance/audit, 5% training. CISO reports to CEO.
responses.evidence: Healthcare Security & Privacy Budget 2024 - Approved

responses.question_text: How do you handle security for acquisitions of other companies' data?
responses.answer_text: Healthcare M&A data integration includes PHI mapping, BAA execution, security classification, encryption implementation, HIPAA compliance assessment, patient notification per state laws, and OCR notification if required.
responses.evidence: M&A Data Security Integration - Healthcare PHI MDASI-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have environmental security controls in data centers?
responses.answer_text: Data centers meet HIPAA physical safeguards with FM-200 fire suppression, N+1 HVAC, UPS and generators, water detection, environmental monitoring, emergency power-off (EPO), and semi-annual environmental security audits.
responses.evidence: Data Center Environmental Security - HIPAA DCES-2024

responses.question_text: What is your security approach for APIs consumed from third parties?
responses.answer_text: Third-party healthcare APIs (lab results, prescription) require BAA, security assessment, mTLS authentication, PHI transmission encryption, availability SLA verification, HL7/FHIR compliance, and annual security re-assessment.
responses.evidence: Third-Party API Integration Security - Healthcare TPAIS-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle security in your incident communications?
responses.answer_text: Healthcare incident communications follow HIPAA breach notification requirements, legal/privacy review, encrypted channels internally, patient notification templates (60-day requirement), HHS notification for 500+ individuals, and media notification when required.
responses.evidence: Incident Communication & HIPAA Breach Notification Plan ICHBN-2024
